gadget.name: War Wizard
gadget.function: 2 Abjuration or Evocation spells. Uses Intellignce instead of Charisma for casting.

benefits.benefit: (Abjuration, Cost, Persistent): Add your Intelligence to your Dexterity when defending against attacks that cause physical stress. FFC pg33

(Evocation): Launch a bolt of pure arcane energy at a single target in your current or an adjacent zone. You must be able to see the target. Attack action, caster’s Charisma vs. target’s Dexterity, attack does physical stress. FFC pg38

(Transmutation, Cost, Persistent): You change the surface of a solid object in your zone (such as the ground, a sword handle, etc.), applying a new aspect that you or your allies gain two free invocations on. Choose one of the following: Slippery Footing, Razor Sharp Corners, Weakened By Dry Rot, or invent your own. You can’t apply this to objects being worn by an unwilling creature (such as armor). FFC pg42
(Transmutation, Prayer, Cost, Persistent): You or a willing ally in your zone gains +1 to Dexterity. Multiple castings of Grace on the same target in the same scene do not stack. FFC pg42

(Transmutation, Trickster, Cost): You can attempt to open a lock. The overcome roll is your Charisma +2 vs. the standard difficulty to pick the lock, or the caster’s charisma +2 roll if it’s magically sealed (see spell “Seal” below). FFC pg42
(Divination, Trickster): When you cast Detect Magic, you become aware of all magically-generated situation aspects in your zone. FFC pg35

(Divination, Cost, Per Session): You may perform a prediction ritual (describe yours - runecasting, reading tea leaves, crystal gazing, divination cards, etc.) You glean some insight into the future represented by three boosts you or allies may spend; these boosts persist until they are spent, or you cast this spell again. This spell requires several minutes to cast, usually an entire scene, rather than just one action. FFC pg35

(Divination, Trickster, Cost, Persistent, Requires Detect Magic or Detect Impurity): This spell allows you to sense the direction to a well-known object. It can be general (find the nearest fresh water) or specific (find the treasure map those thieves stole from me). FFC pg35

stunts.stunt: You gain an extra mild consequence slot, and you gain a +2 to Constitution-based rolls to resist the effects of poison.
